meanings.sent1: The vitiated milk had a sour smell.
meanings.sent2: The vitiated fruit was mushy and unappetizing.
meanings.sent3: The vitiated cake tasted like old socks.
meanings.sent4: Her vitiated phone battery drained quickly.
meanings.sent5: The vitiated water was murky and undrinkable.

meanings.sent1: The vitiated plan led to chaos.
meanings.sent2: His vitiated argument fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent3: The vitiated computer virus caused havoc.
meanings.sent4: The vitiated relationship was beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The vitiated medicine had no healing power.

meanings.definition: To impair the quality or efficiency of
meanings.sent1: Neglecting maintenance can vitiate the machinery.
meanings.sent2: His laziness vitiated his chances of success.
meanings.sent3: Adding too much salt can vitiate the dish.
meanings.sent4: The storm vitiated the structural integrity of the building.
meanings.sent5: His lies vitiated the trust between them.
